intro: Linociera nervosa, commonly known as the veined linociera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmately lobed leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. Linociera nervosa typically grows as an epiphytic or terrestrial shrub, often found in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists alike.
